sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Returns true for entries of an array that are NaN's (i.e., Not-a-Numbers). The usage is y = isnan(x) The result is a logical array of the same size as x, which is true if x is not-a-number, and false otherwise. Note that for complex data types that the result is true if either the real or imaginary parts are NaNs.

sect1.title: Example
sect1.para: Suppose we have an array of floats with one element that is nan:
